sen.j: カタカムナ文明とは、かつて日本に存在したとされる超古代文明。
sen.e: Katakamuna civilization is super ancient civilization that is said to have existed in Japan.
Katakamuna civilization is a super ancient civilization that is said to have existed in Japan.
Katakamuna civilization is a super ancient civilization that is said to have existed in Japan.

sen.j: カタカムナ文字を使用していたとされる事から呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is so called because the Katakamuna characters were used.
It is so called because the Katakamuna characters were used.
It is so called because the Katakamuna characters were used.

sen.j: 縄文時代以前、旧石器時代 (日本)末期に存在したとされる。
sen.e: Katakamuna civilization is said to have existed in the end of the paleolithic period (Japan) before the Jomon period.
Katakamuna civilization is said to have existed at the end of the paleolithic period (Japan) before the Jomon period.
Katakamuna civilization is said to have existed at the end of the paleolithic period (Japan) before the Jomon period.

sen.j: 極めて高度な科学技術や独自の哲学体系を持っていたことがカタカムナ文献から推測される。
sen.e: According to the Katakamuna documents, it is assumed that the civilianization had highly sophisticated technology and an original system of philosophy.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: According to the Katakamuna documents, it is assumed that the civilization had highly sophisticated technology and an original system of philosophy.
According to the Katakamuna documents, it is assumed that the civilization had highly sophisticated technology and an original system of philosophy.

sen.j: しかし、現在においてこの文明の存在を示す建造物や遺物は、これ以外には見つかっていない。
sen.e: However, so far, no other buildings or remains that indicate existence of this civilization have been found.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, so far, no other buildings or remains that indicate existence of this civilization have been found.
However, so far, no other buildings or remains that indicate existence of this civilization have been found.

sen.j: 日本で初めてカタカムナ文明の存在を唱えたのは楢崎皐月（ならさき・こうげつ）である。
sen.e: Kogetsu NARASAKI was the first to advocate the existence of the Katakamuna civilization in Japan.
Kogetsu NARASAKI was the first to advocate the existence of the Katakamuna civilization in Japan.
Kogetsu NARASAKI was the first to advocate the existence of the Katakamuna civilization in Japan.

sen.j: 皐月の述懐によれば、皐月は兵庫県六甲山系の金鳥山中での調査中に父が「カタカムナ神社の宮司」であったと名乗る平十字（ひらとうじ）という猟師と出会い、その神社の御神体である巻物を見せてもらったという。
sen.e: According to his remembrance, Kogetsu met a hunter named Hiratoji whose father was the "Guji (chief of those who serves shrine, controls festivals and general affairs) of Katakamuna Shrine" during his investigation in Kincho-san mountain in Rokkosan in Hyogo Prefecture and he showed him the makimono, the shintai (sacred object) of the shrine.

According to his remembrance, Kogetsu met a hunter named Hiratoji whose father was the "Guji (chief of those who serves shrine, controls festivals and general affairs) of Katakamuna Shrine" during his investigation in Kincho-san mountain in Rokkosan in Hyogo Prefecture and he showed him the makimono, the shintai (sacred object) of the shrine.

According to his remembrance, Kogetsu met a hunter named Hiratoji whose father was the "Guji (chief of those who serves shrine, controls festivals and general affairs) of Katakamuna Shrine" during his investigation in Kincho-san mountain in Rokkosan in Hyogo Prefecture and he showed him the makimono, the shintai (sacred object) of the shrine.

sen.j: そこに書かれていたのは丸と直線で作られた幾何学的な文字であった。
sen.e: What was written there was geometric characters created by circles and straight lines.
What was written there were geometric characters created by circles and straight lines.
What was written there were geometric characters created by circles and straight lines.

sen.j: これが貴重な文献であると直感した皐月は、平十字に書写を願い出た。
sen.e: Kogetsu, who felt this was the important document by instinct asked Hiratoji to allow him to copy it.
Kogetsu, who instinctively felt this was an important document asked Hiratoji to allow him to copy it.
Kogetsu, who instinctively felt this was an important document asked Hiratoji to allow him to copy it.

sen.j: 平十字は快諾し、皐月は研究用に持っていた大学ノートにその文字を全て写し取ったという。
sen.e: Hiratoji kindly agreed to the request and Kogetsu transferred all characters to the notebook he carried for research.
Hiratoji kindly agreed to the request and Kogetsu transferred all characters to the notebook he carried for research.
Hiratoji kindly agreed to the request and Kogetsu transferred all characters to the notebook he carried for research.

sen.j: その文章量は一日で写し終わるようなものではなく、それから20日間、皐月のところへ巻物を手に平十字が毎日通ったという。
sen.e: The amount of document was not what can be transferred in a day, so Hiratoji visited Kogetsu every day to deliver the makimono for 20 days.
The amount of document was not what can be transferred in a day, so Hiratoji visited Kogetsu every day to deliver the makimono for 20 days.
The amount of document was not what can be transferred in a day, so Hiratoji visited Kogetsu every day to deliver the makimono for 20 days.

sen.j: 皐月はそれまで度々実家に葉書を送って安否を知らせていたが、このときは一ヶ月間葉書をよこさなかったと皐月の娘は述懐している。
sen.e: Kogetsu often sent postcards to his house to notify his family of his safety, but his daughter remembers that Kogetsu did not sent any postcards for a month during the time.
Kogetsu often sent postcards to his house to notify his family of his safety, but his daughter remembers that Kogetsu did not send any postcards for a month during this time.
Kogetsu often sent postcards to his house to notify his family of his safety, but his daughter remembers that Kogetsu did not send any postcards for a month during this time.

sen.j: 後に皐月は五年をかけてこの文書（通称「カタカムナ文献」）の解読に成功。
sen.e: Later, Kogetsu succeeded in deciphering this document (commonly called "Katakamuna documents") over five years.
Later, Kogetsu succeeded in deciphering this document (commonly called "Katakamuna documents") over five years.
Later, Kogetsu succeeded in deciphering this document (commonly called "Katakamuna documents") over five years.

sen.j: その内容が自然科学的な実用書であった事を突き止めた。
sen.e: He found that the documentdealt with natural science for practical purpose.
He found that the document dealt with natural science for practical purpose.
He found that the document dealt with natural science for practical purpose.

sen.j: この文字はそれが祀られていたとされる場所の名から「カタカムナ文字」と呼ばれ、その文字を使用していた文明として「カタカムナ文明」が提唱されたのである。
sen.e: These characters were called "Katakamuna characters" from the location where they were enshrined and "Katakamuna Civilization" was advocated as the civilization in which the characters were used.
These characters were called "Katakamuna characters" from the location where they were enshrined and "Katakamuna Civilization" was advocated as the civilization in which the characters were used.
These characters were called "Katakamuna characters" from the location where they were enshrined and "Katakamuna Civilization" was advocated as the civilization in which the characters were used.
Negative ion
Negative ion
Negative ion

sen.j: マイナスイオン研究家の山野井昇によれば、楢崎皐月氏が名づけた「植物波農法」とは実は「マイナスイオン農法」なのだという。
sen.e: According to Noboru YAMANOI, a researcher of negative ions, "Plant wave agriculture method" named by Kogetsu NARASAKI is, in fact, "Negative ion agriculture".
According to Noboru YAMANOI, a researcher of negative ions, "Plant wave agriculture method" named by Kogetsu NARASAKI is, in fact, "Negative ion agriculture".
According to Noboru YAMANOI, a researcher of negative ions, "Plant wave agriculture method" named by Kogetsu NARASAKI is, in fact, "Negative ion agriculture".

tit.j: フィクションでのカタカムナ文明

sen.j: この文明（正確には皐月の解読した文書）をモチーフとして作られたのがアルケミストのオリジナルゲーム「片神名〜喪われた因果律〜」である。
sen.e: With a motif of this civilization (to be precise, the document deciphered by Kogetsu), Alchemist created their original game "Katakana - lost causality".
With a motif of this civilization (to be precise, the document deciphered by Kogetsu), Alchemist created their original game "Katakana - lost causality".
With a motif of this civilization (to be precise, the document deciphered by Kogetsu), Alchemist created their original game "Katakana - lost causality".

sen.j: ロゴの背景にカタカムナ文字が使われ、作中にもカタカムナ文献と思われる文献が登場するなど、非常に重要な役目を果たしている。
sen.e: The Katakamuna characters are used on the background of the logo and documents considered to be katakamuna documents appear and play very important roles in the story.
